summary: This is an internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) discussing a media inquiry from reporter Jon Bandler. Bandler sought clarification on whether video surveillance footage from Jeffrey Epstein's cell following his earlier attempted suicide was preserved, a point raised during a court hearing for another inmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, who was Epstein's cellmate.

events.title: Epstein's Earlier Attempted Suicide
events.description: A prior suicide attempt by Jeffrey Epstein while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), which prompted questions about the preservation of cell video footage.

keyFacts: During a December 18, 2019 court hearing for inmate Nicholas Tartaglione, his defense lawyer stated it was their understanding that video surveillance footage from Jeffrey Epstein's cell, following an earlier suicide attempt, 'no longer exists' and 'was not preserved.'
Reporter Jon Bandler sought clarification from the U.S. Attorney's Office on whether video ever existed and if all avenues to restore or preserve it had been exhausted.
An internal USANYS email indicates the judge asked prosecutors to look into the video preservation issue, and they stated they were in the process of doing so.
The document highlights ongoing media and legal scrutiny regarding the preservation of evidence related to Epstein's incarceration and death.
